summary: This bill, the Haliwa Saponi Indian Tribe of North Carolina Act, aims to extend the full measure of the federal government-to-government relationship between the United States and the Haliwa Saponi Indian Tribe. It recognizes the tribe's historical background, defines key terms, and grants the tribe eligibility for federal services and benefits.  It also authorizes the Secretary of the Interior to take land into trust for the tribe and establish a reservation.
